name: A. Supermarket
statement:
We often go to supermarkets to buy some fruits or vegetables, and on the
tag there prints the price for a kilo. But in some supermarkets, when
asked how much the items are, the clerk will say that a for b kilos (You
don’t need to care about what is), the same as a/b for a kilo.Now
imagine you’d like to buy m kilos of apples. You’ve asked n supermarkets
and got the prices. Find the minimum cost for those apples.You can
assume that there are enough apples in all supermarkets.
